cards.name: Skyshroud Cutter
cards.text: If you control a Forest, rather than pay this spell's mana cost, you may have each other player gain 5 life.
cards.originalText: If you control a forest, you may have each other player gain 5 life instead of paying Skyshroud Cutter's mana cost.

cards.name: Skyshroud Poacher
cards.text: {3}, {T}: Search your library for an Elf permanent card and put it onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.
cards.flavor: "It's OK. They're just elves."

rulings.text: You do not have to find an Elf card if you do not want to.

cards.originalText: {3}, {T}: Search your library for an Elf card and put that card into play. Then shuffle your library.

cards.name: Skyshroud Ridgeback
cards.text: Fading 2 (This creature enters the battlefield with two fade counters on it. At the beginning of your upkeep, remove a fade counter from it. If you can't, sacrifice it.)
cards.originalText: Fading 2 (This creature comes into play with two fade counters on it. At the beginning of your upkeep, remove a fade counter from it. If you can't, sacrifice it.)

cards.name: Skyshroud Sentinel
cards.text: When Skyshroud Sentinel enters the battlefield, you may search your library for up to three cards named Skyshroud Sentinel, reveal them, and put them into your hand. If you do, shuffle your library.
cards.originalText: When Skyshroud Sentinel comes into play, you may search your library for up to three Skyshroud Sentinel cards, reveal them, and put them into your hand. If you do, shuffle your library.

cards.name: Stampede Driver
cards.text: {1}{G}, {T}, Discard a card: Creatures you control get +1/+1 and gain trample until end of turn.
cards.flavor: "The thunder of hooves is music to my ears."

rulings.text: Stampede Driver's ability affects only creatures you control at the time it resolves. Creatures you begin to control later in the turn won't get +1/+1 or gain trample.

cards.originalText: {1}{G}, {T}, Discard a card from your hand: Creatures you control get +1/+1 and gain trample until end of turn.

cards.name: Treetop Bracers
cards.text:
Enchant creature (Target a creature as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that creature.)
Enchanted creature gets +1/+1 and can't be blocked except by creatures with flying.
cards.flavor: Gravity is truly what you make of it.

rulings.text: Creatures with the Reach ability (such as Giant Spider) don't actually have Flying, so they can't block a creature enchanted with this.

cards.originalText: Enchanted creature gets +1/+1 and can be blocked only by creatures with flying.

cards.name: Wild Mammoth
cards.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, if a player controls more creatures than each other player, the player who controls the most creatures gains control of Wild Mammoth.
cards.flavor: "Sit. Heel! Down! HELP!"
cards.originalText: At the beginning of your upkeep, if a player controls more creatures than any other, that player gains control of Wild Mammoth.

cards.name: Woodripper
cards.text:
Fading 3 (This creature enters the battlefield with three fade counters on it. At the beginning of your upkeep, remove a fade counter from it. If you can't, sacrifice it.)
{1}, Remove a fade counter from Woodripper: Destroy target artifact.
cards.originalText:
Fading 3 (This creature comes into play with three fade counters on it. At the beginning of your upkeep, remove a fade counter from it. If you can't, sacrifice it.)
{1}, Remove a fade counter from Woodripper: Destroy target artifact.

cards.name: Belbe's Armor
cards.text: {X}, {T}: Target creature gets -X/+X until end of turn.
cards.flavor: It protects her from the ravages of Phyrexia and the savages of Rath.
cards.originalText: {X}, {T}: Target creature gets -X/+X until end of turn.

cards.name: Belbe's Portal
cards.text:
As Belbe's Portal enters the battlefield, choose a creature type.
{3}, {T}: You may put a creature card of the chosen type from your hand onto the battlefield.
cards.flavor: The fight will continue on a new battlefield.

rulings.text: Putting the card onto the battlefield is optional. When the ability resolves, you can choose not to.

cards.originalText:
As Belbe's Portal comes into play, choose a creature type.
{3}, {T}: Put a creature card of the chosen type from your hand into play.

cards.name: Complex Automaton
cards.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, if you control seven or more permanents, return Complex Automaton to its owner's hand.
cards.flavor:
"This wasteful design cannot possibly be Phyrexian."
—Belbe
cards.originalText: At the beginning of your upkeep, if you control seven or more permanents, return Complex Automaton to its owner's hand.

cards.name: Eye of Yawgmoth
cards.text: {3}, {T}, Sacrifice a creature: Reveal a number of cards from the top of your library equal to the sacrificed creature's power. Put one into your hand and exile the rest.
cards.originalText: {3}, {T}, Sacrifice a creature: Reveal cards from the top of your library equal to the sacrificed creature's power. Put one into your hand and remove the rest from the game.

cards.name: Flint Golem
cards.text: Whenever Flint Golem becomes blocked, defending player puts the top three cards of their library into their graveyard.
cards.originalText: Whenever Flint Golem becomes blocked, defending player puts the top three cards of his or her library into his or her graveyard.

cards.name: Flowstone Armor
cards.text:
You may choose not to untap Flowstone Armor during your untap step.
{3}, {T}: Target creature gets +1/-1 for as long as Flowstone Armor remains tapped.
cards.originalText:
You may choose not to untap Flowstone Armor during your untap step. 
{3}, {T}: Target creature gets +1/-1 as long as Flowstone Armor remains tapped.

cards.name: Flowstone Thopter
cards.text: {1}: Flowstone Thopter gets +1/-1 and gains flying until end of turn.
cards.flavor: Airborne flowstone isn't less dangerous, only less common.
cards.originalText: {1}: Flowstone Thopter gets +1/-1 and gains flying until end of turn.

cards.name: Kill Switch
cards.text: {2}, {T}: Tap all other artifacts. They don't untap during their controllers' untap steps for as long as Kill Switch remains tapped.
cards.flavor: Success is largely a matter of knowing which lever to pull.

rulings.text: Note that you can't choose to leave this card tapped during your untap step (unless some other effect says so).

Only the artifacts that it tried to tap when the ability resolved are prevented from untapping. Artifacts that enter the battlefield after that or permanents that become artifacts after that are not affected.

cards.originalText: {2}, {T}: Tap all other artifacts. They don't untap during their controllers' untap steps as long as Kill Switch remains tapped.

cards.name: Parallax Inhibitor
cards.text: {1}, {T}, Sacrifice Parallax Inhibitor: Put a fade counter on each permanent with fading you control.
cards.flavor:
"The best I can offer is a temporary reprieve."
—Belbe
cards.originalText: {1}, {T}, Sacrifice Parallax Inhibitor: Put a fade counter on each permanent with fading you control.

cards.name: Predator, Flagship
cards.text:
{2}: Target creature gains flying until end of turn.
{5}, {T}: Destroy target creature with flying.
cards.flavor:
"The scourge of Skyshroud is airborne once more."
—Oracle en-Vec
cards.originalText:
{2}: Target creature gains flying until end of turn.
{5}, {T}: Destroy target creature with flying.

cards.name: Rackling
cards.text: At the beginning of each opponent's upkeep, Rackling deals X damage to that player, where X is 3 minus the number of cards in their hand.
cards.flavor: "This may hurt a little."
cards.originalText: At the beginning of each opponent's upkeep, Rackling deals X damage to that player, where X is the number of cards in his or her hand fewer than three.

cards.name: Rejuvenation Chamber
cards.text:
Fading 2 (This artifact enters the battlefield with two fade counters on it. At the beginning of your upkeep, remove a fade counter from it. If you can't, sacrifice it.)
{T}: You gain 2 life.
cards.originalText:
Fading 2 (This artifact comes into play with two fade counters on it. At the beginning of your upkeep, remove a fade counter from it. If you can't, sacrifice it.)
{T}: You gain 2 life.

cards.name: Rusting Golem
cards.text:
Fading 5 (This creature enters the battlefield with five fade counters on it. At the beginning of your upkeep, remove a fade counter from it. If you can't, sacrifice it.)
Rusting Golem's power and toughness are each equal to the number of fade counters on it.
cards.originalText:
Fading 5 (This creature comes into play with five fade counters on it. At the beginning of your upkeep, remove a fade counter from it. If you can't, sacrifice it.)
Rusting Golem's power and toughness are each equal to the number of fade counters on it.

cards.name: Tangle Wire
cards.text:
Fading 4 (This artifact enters the battlefield with four fade counters on it. At the beginning of your upkeep, remove a fade counter from it. If you can't, sacrifice it.)
At the beginning of each player's upkeep, that player taps an untapped artifact, creature, or land they control for each fade counter on Tangle Wire.
cards.originalText:
Fading 4 (This artifact comes into play with four fade counters on it. At the beginning of your upkeep, remove a fade counter from it. If you can't, sacrifice it.)
At the beginning of each player's upkeep, that player taps an untapped artifact, creature, or land he or she controls for each fade counter on Tangle Wire.

cards.name: Viseling
cards.text: At the beginning of each opponent's upkeep, Viseling deals X damage to that player, where X is the number of cards in their hand minus 4.
cards.flavor: "This may hurt a lot."
cards.originalText: At the beginning of each opponent's upkeep, Viseling deals X damage to that player, where X is the number of cards in his or her hand minus four.

cards.name: Kor Haven
cards.text:
{T}: Add {C}.
{1}{W}, {T}: Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt by target attacking creature this turn.
cards.originalText:
{T}: Add one colorless mana to your mana pool.
{1}{W}, {T}: Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt by target attacking creature this turn.

cards.text:
{T}: Add {C}.
{4}, {T}, Sacrifice a land: Rath's Edge deals 1 damage to any target.
cards.originalText:
{T}: Add one colorless mana to your mana pool.
{4}, {T}, Sacrifice a land: Rath's Edge deals 1 damage to target creature or player.

cards.name: Terrain Generator
cards.text:
{T}: Add {C}.
{2}, {T}: You may put a basic land card from your hand onto the battlefield tapped.

rulings.text: Putting a land onto the battlefield this way does not count as your one land play for the turn.
Putting the card onto the battlefield is optional. When the ability resolves, you can choose not to.

cards.originalText:
{T}: Add one colorless mana to your mana pool.
{2}, {T}: Put a basic land card from your hand into play tapped.

cards.name: Altar's Light
cards.text: Exile target artifact or enchantment.
cards.flavor:
"The altar does nothing; the device is crushed under the weight of its own impurity."
—Ushanti, leonin seer
cards.originalText: Remove target artifact or enchantment from the game.

cards.name: Arrest
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature can't attack or block, and its activated abilities can't be activated.
cards.flavor:
"Unfortunately, it doesn't restrain the beast's smell."
—Glissa Sunseeker

rulings.text: Activated abilities contain a colon. They're generally written "[Cost]: [Effect]." Some keywords are activated abilities and will have colons in their reminder text.

cards.originalText: Enchanted creature can't attack or block, and its activated abilities can't be played.

cards.name: Auriok Bladewarden
cards.text: {T}: Target creature gets +X/+X until end of turn, where X is Auriok Bladewarden's power.
cards.flavor: The Auriok have learned through constant struggle that allies are more precious than water.
cards.originalText: {T}: Target creature gets +X/+X until end of turn, where X is Auriok Bladewarden's power.

cards.name: Auriok Steelshaper
cards.text:
Equip costs you pay cost {1} less.
As long as Auriok Steelshaper is equipped, each creature you control that's a Soldier or a Knight gets +1/+1.
cards.flavor: They put their safety in his hands. He puts sharpened steel in theirs.

foreignNames.name: オーリオックの鋼打ち

cards.originalText:
Equip costs you pay cost {1} less.
As long as Auriok Steelshaper is equipped, Soldiers and Knights you control get +1/+1.

cards.name: Auriok Transfixer
cards.text: {W}, {T}: Tap target artifact.
cards.flavor: "My grandfather knew enough spells to fill a hundred scrolls. Nowadays, if a spell cannot fight the levelers, it is not even taught to our young."

foreignNames.name: オーリオックの貫通者

cards.originalText: {W}, {T}: Tap target artifact.

cards.name: Awe Strike
cards.text: The next time target creature would deal damage this turn, prevent that damage. You gain life equal to the damage prevented this way.
cards.flavor: Stunned by the mere presence of the leonin kha, the nim raider quickly fell to its knees.
cards.originalText: The next time target creature would deal damage this turn, prevent that damage. You gain life equal to the damage prevented this way.

cards.name: Blinding Beam
cards.text:
Choose one —
• Tap two target creatures.
• Creatures don't untap during target player's next untap step.
Entwine {1} (Choose both if you pay the entwine cost.)

rulings.text: The second mode affects all creatures during the player's next untap step, including creatures controlled by other players (who may have untapped because of Seedborn Muse, for example) and creatures that weren't on the battlefield when Blinding Beam resolved.

cards.originalText:
Choose one Tap two target creatures; or creatures don't untap during target player's next untap step.
Entwine {1} (Choose both if you pay the entwine cost.)

cards.name: Leonin Abunas
cards.text: Artifacts you control have hexproof. (They can't be the targets of spells or abilities your opponents control.)
cards.flavor: Only leonin clerics who can survive the Razor Fields for one turning of the suns can stand in the Cave of Light.
cards.originalText: Artifacts you control can't be the targets of spells or abilities your opponents control.

cards.name: Leonin Den-Guard
cards.text: As long as Leonin Den-Guard is equipped, it gets +1/+1 and has vigilance.
cards.flavor: No one under the four suns can elude the watchful eye of the den-guard.
cards.originalText: As long as Leonin Den-Guard is equipped, it gets +1/+1 and attacking doesn't cause it to tap.

cards.name: Leonin Elder
cards.text: Whenever an artifact enters the battlefield, you may gain 1 life.
cards.flavor:
"The wisdom of the elders is just as much a weapon as a sword or spear. We must learn to wield it."
—Ushanti, leonin seer
cards.originalText: Whenever an artifact comes into play, you may gain 1 life.

cards.name: Leonin Skyhunter
cards.text: Flying
cards.flavor: The skyhunters were born when the first leonin gazed at the heavens and wished to hunt the birds overhead.
cards.originalText: Flying

cards.name: Loxodon Mender
cards.text: {W}, {T}: Regenerate target artifact.
cards.flavor: The Auriok believe that in the hands of a loxodon, no weapon can be broken.
cards.originalText: {W}, {T}: Regenerate target artifact.

cards.name: Loxodon Peacekeeper
cards.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, the player with the lowest life total gains control of Loxodon Peacekeeper. If two or more players are tied for lowest life total, you choose one of them, and that player gains control of Loxodon Peacekeeper.

foreignNames.name: ロクソドンの平和の番人

cards.originalText: At the beginning of your upkeep, the player with the lowest life total gains control of Loxodon Peacekeeper. If two or more players are tied for lowest life total, you choose one of them, and that player gains control of Loxodon Peacekeeper.

cards.name: Loxodon Punisher
cards.text: Loxodon Punisher gets +2/+2 for each Equipment attached to it.
cards.flavor: The loxodons believe punishment comes in two steps: pain and atonement. They carry a weapon for each.
cards.originalText: Loxodon Punisher gets +2/+2 for each Equipment attached to it.

cards.name: Luminous Angel
cards.text:
Flying
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may create a 1/1 white Spirit creature token with flying.
cards.originalText:
Flying
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may put a 1/1 white Spirit creature token with flying into play.

cards.name: Raise the Alarm
cards.text: Create two 1/1 white Soldier creature tokens.
cards.flavor: "The nim raid our homes without warning. We must defend our homes without hesitation."
cards.originalText: Put two 1/1 white Soldier creature tokens into play.

cards.name: Razor Barrier
cards.text: Target permanent you control gains protection from artifacts or from the color of your choice until end of turn.
cards.flavor: "We protect our homelands. Why should they not protect us?"
cards.originalText: Target permanent you control gains protection from artifacts or from the color of your choice until end of turn.

cards.name: Roar of the Kha
cards.text:
Choose one —
• Creatures you control get +1/+1 until end of turn.
• Untap all creatures you control.
Entwine {1}{W} (Choose both if you pay the entwine cost.)
cards.originalText:
Choose one Creatures you control get +1/+1 until end of turn; or untap all creatures you control.
Entwine {1}{W} (Choose both if you pay the entwine cost.)

cards.name: Rule of Law
cards.text: Each player can't cast more than one spell each turn.
cards.flavor: Appointed by the kha himself, members of the tribunal ensure all disputes are settled with the utmost fairness.
cards.originalText: Each player can't play more than one spell each turn.

cards.name: Second Sunrise
cards.text: Each player returns to the battlefield all artifact, creature, enchantment, and land cards in their graveyard that were put there from the battlefield this turn.
cards.flavor: The bright tunnel sometimes leads back to life.
cards.originalText: Each player returns to play all artifact, creature, enchantment, and land cards that were put into his or her graveyard from play this turn.

cards.name: Skyhunter Cub
cards.text: As long as Skyhunter Cub is equipped, it gets +1/+1 and has flying.
cards.flavor: Every young leonin wishes to become a skyhunter, for they soar closest to the suns.
cards.originalText: As long as Skyhunter Cub is equipped, it gets +1/+1 and has flying.

cards.name: Skyhunter Patrol
cards.text: Flying, first strike (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach, and it deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)
cards.flavor:
"They are the first to raise the alarm when the levelers attack, and the first to risk their lives to defend the pride."
—Raksha Golden Cub, leonin kha
cards.originalText: Flying, first strike

cards.name: Slith Ascendant
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever Slith Ascendant deals combat damage to a player, put a +1/+1 counter on it.
cards.flavor: Instinctively drawn to the light of its "mother-sun," each slith follows that sun's path around Mirrodin.
cards.originalText:
Flying
Whenever Slith Ascendant deals combat damage to a player, put a +1/+1 counter on it.

cards.name: Solar Tide
cards.text:
Choose one —
• Destroy all creatures with power 2 or less.
• Destroy all creatures with power 3 or greater.
Entwine—Sacrifice two lands. (Choose both if you pay the entwine cost.)
cards.originalText:
Choose one Destroy all creatures with power 2 or less; or destroy all creatures with power 3 or greater.
Entwine—Sacrifice two lands. (Choose both if you pay the entwine cost.)

cards.name: Soul Nova
cards.text: Exile target attacking creature and all Equipment attached to it.
cards.flavor: Within seconds, the nim was consumed in blinding sunfire. Afterwards, only a puddle of molten iron remained.
cards.originalText: Remove target attacking creature and all Equipment attached to it from the game.

cards.name: Sphere of Purity
cards.text: If an artifact would deal damage to you, prevent 1 of that damage.
cards.flavor: Purity rejects artifice.
cards.originalText: If an artifact would deal damage to you, prevent 1 of that damage.

cards.name: Taj-Nar Swordsmith
cards.text: When Taj-Nar Swordsmith enters the battlefield, you may pay {X}. If you do, search your library for an Equipment card with converted mana cost X or less and put that card onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.

foreignNames.name: タージ＝ナールの剣鍛冶

cards.originalText: When Taj-Nar Swordsmith comes into play, you may pay {X}. If you do, search your library for an Equipment card with converted mana cost X or less and put that card into play. Then shuffle your library.

cards.name: Tempest of Light
cards.text: Destroy all enchantments.
cards.flavor:
"This world reeks of another's hand. Someone or something is defying the power of the gods and shaping this planet. I intend for it to stop."
—Glissa Sunseeker
cards.originalText: Destroy all enchantments.

cards.name: Annul
cards.text: Counter target artifact or enchantment spell.
cards.flavor:
"Murder of the living is tragic, but murder of the idea is unforgivable."
—Janus, speaker of the synod
cards.originalText: Counter target artifact or enchantment spell.

cards.name: Assert Authority
cards.text:
Affinity for artifacts (This spell costs {1} less to cast for each artifact you control.)
Counter target spell. If that spell is countered this way, exile it instead of putting it into its owner's graveyard.
cards.originalText:
Affinity for artifacts (This spell costs {1} less to play for each artifact you control.)
Counter target spell. If it's countered this way, remove it from the game instead of putting it into its owner's graveyard.

cards.name: Broodstar
cards.text:
Affinity for artifacts (This spell costs {1} less to cast for each artifact you control.)
Flying
Broodstar's power and toughness are each equal to the number of artifacts you control.
cards.originalText:
Affinity for artifacts (This spell costs {1} less to play for each artifact you control.)
Flying
Broodstar's power and toughness are each equal to the number of artifacts you control.

cards.name: Disarm
cards.text: Unattach all Equipment from target creature.
cards.flavor: "Be thankful I left you your clothes."

rulings.text: The Equipment remains on the battlefield under its controller's control, but is no longer attached to that creature.

cards.originalText: Unattach all Equipment from target creature.

cards.name: Domineer
cards.text:
Enchant artifact creature
You control enchanted artifact creature.
cards.flavor: Since they haven't seen their original master for millennia, golems are eager to take orders from anyone.

rulings.text: The enchanted permanent must be both an artifact and a creature. Domineer can be cast only on an artifact creature. Domineer "falls off" and is put into the graveyard if the artifact creature it's enchanting stops being an artifact or stops being a creature.

cards.originalText: You control enchanted artifact creature.

cards.name: Dream's Grip
cards.text:
Choose one —
• Tap target permanent.
• Untap target permanent.
Entwine {1} (Choose both if you pay the entwine cost.)
cards.originalText:
Choose one Tap target permanent; or untap target permanent.
Entwine {1} (Choose both if you pay the entwine cost.)

cards.name: Fabricate
cards.text: Search your library for an artifact card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library.
cards.flavor: "The secret to invention is to see something in your mind, then find where it hides in the world."
cards.originalText: Search your library for an artifact card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library.

cards.name: Fatespinner
cards.text: At the beginning of each opponent's upkeep, that player chooses draw step, main phase, or combat phase. The player skips each instance of the chosen step or phase this turn.
cards.flavor: No one knows what she is watching, but she never takes her eyes off it.

rulings.text: That opponent skips only the phases or steps that are chosen.
If there are multiple phases with the same name in the turn, your opponent skips them all. This is true even if a new step or phase is added to the turn after the ability resolves.
If more than one Fatespinner affects you at the start of your upkeep, you can choose the same step or phase for each one.

cards.originalText: At the beginning of each opponent's upkeep, that player chooses draw step, main phase, or combat phase. The player skips each instance of the chosen step or phase this turn.

cards.name: Inertia Bubble
cards.text:
Enchant artifact
Enchanted artifact doesn't untap during its controller's untap step.
cards.flavor:
"I wouldn't want you to hurt yourself."
—Bruenna, Neurok leader
cards.originalText: Enchanted artifact doesn't untap during its controller's untap step.

cards.name: Looming Hoverguard
cards.text:
Flying
When Looming Hoverguard enters the battlefield, put target artifact on top of its owner's library.
cards.flavor: Although mute, hoverguards get their message across loud and clear.
cards.originalText:
Flying
When Looming Hoverguard comes into play, put target artifact on top of its owner's library.

cards.name: Lumengrid Augur
cards.text: {1}, {T}: Target player draws a card, then discards a card. If that player discards an artifact card this way, untap Lumengrid Augur.
cards.flavor: Information pumps like blood through vedalken society.

foreignNames.name: ルーメングリッドの占い師

cards.originalText: {1}, {T}: Target player draws a card, then discards a card from his or her hand. If that player discards an artifact card this way, untap Lumengrid Augur.

cards.name: Lumengrid Sentinel
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever an artifact enters the battlefield under your control, you may tap target permanent.
cards.flavor: The vedalken order their Neurok sentinels to watch over the shores of the Quicksilver Sea, as if they know of intruders yet to come.

foreignNames.name: ルーメングリッドの歩哨

cards.originalText:
Flying
Whenever an artifact comes into play under your control, you may tap target permanent.

cards.name: Lumengrid Warden
cards.flavor: The Neurok, like the vedalken, are on a constant quest for knowledge. It is their currency, their trade, their life.

foreignNames.name: ルーメングリッドの管理人

cards.name: March of the Machines
cards.text: Each noncreature artifact is an artifact creature with power and toughness each equal to its converted mana cost. (Equipment that's a creature can't equip a creature.)

rulings.text: If a noncreature artifact is also another card type, such as enchantment or land, it will retain those types in addition to being an artifact creature.

If an Equipment becomes a creature, it can no longer equip a creature. If it's currently attached to a creature, it becomes unattached (but remains on the battlefield). You can activate the Equipment's equip ability, but it won't do anything.
Each artifact land has a converted mana cost of 0. March of the Machines makes them 0/0 creatures, which are put into the graveyard as a state-based action.

If a noncreature artifact becomes an artifact creature this way and then another effect animates it, the new effect overrides March of the Machines's effect. For example, Chimeric Staff is a 4/4 creature while March of the Machines is on the battlefield. If you activate Chimeric Staff's ability and choose X = 5, Chimeric Staff will be a 5/5 artifact creature for the rest of the turn.

A noncreature permanent that turns into a creature is subject to the "summoning sickness" rule: It can only attack, and its {T} abilities can only be activated, if its controller has continuously controlled that permanent since the beginning of their most recent turn.

cards.originalText: Each noncreature artifact is an artifact creature with power and toughness each equal to its converted mana cost. (Equipment that's a creature can't equip a creature.)

cards.name: Neurok Familiar
cards.text:
Flying
When Neurok Familiar enters the battlefield, reveal the top card of your library. If it's an artifact card, put it into your hand. Otherwise, put it into your graveyard.

foreignNames.name: ニューロックの使い魔

cards.originalText:
Flying
When Neurok Familiar comes into play, reveal the top card of your library. If it's an artifact card, put it into your hand. Otherwise, put it into your graveyard.

cards.name: Neurok Spy
cards.text: Neurok Spy can't be blocked as long as defending player controls an artifact.
cards.flavor: From the murk of Mephidross to the heart of Kuldotha, the vedalken send their servants forth to gather knowledge from every inch of Mirrodin.

foreignNames.name: ニューロックのスパイ

cards.originalText: Neurok Spy is unblockable as long as defending player controls an artifact.

cards.name: Override
cards.text: Counter target spell unless its controller pays {1} for each artifact you control.
cards.flavor: "The Knowledge Pool has all the answers—especially 'No.'"
cards.originalText: Counter target spell unless its controller pays {1} for each artifact you control.

cards.name: Psychic Membrane
cards.text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
Whenever Psychic Membrane blocks, you may draw a card.
cards.flavor: The vedalken always put their best thought forward.
cards.originalText:
(Walls can't attack.)
Whenever Psychic Membrane blocks, you may draw a card.

cards.name: Quicksilver Elemental
cards.text:
{U}: Quicksilver Elemental gains all activated abilities of target creature until end of turn. (If any of the abilities use that creature's name, use this creature's name instead.)
You may spend blue mana as though it were mana of any color to pay the activation costs of Quicksilver Elemental's abilities.

rulings.text: If you use this card to gain Wall of Deceit's ability to turn itself face down, you will not be able to turn this card face up because it will not have the Morph ability.
If you make two copies of an ability that can be activated once a turn, you can activate each of them once a turn.
You can activate the ability more than once, collecting abilities from multiple creatures (or the same creature more than once).
Quicksilver Elemental gains only activated abilities. It doesn't gain keyword abilities (unless those keyword abilities are activated), triggered abilities, or static abilities.
Quicksilver Elemental can gain the activated abilities of any creature on the battlefield that you can target with its ability, even if you don't control that creature.

The granted abilities effectively use "this permanent," rather than "[that card's name]," so you treat the abilities as if they were printed on Quicksilver Elemental. For example, you treat an ability that says "Sacrifice a creature: Nantuko Husk gets +2/+2 until end of turn" as "Sacrifice a creature: Quicksilver Elemental gets +2/+2 until end of turn."
Quicksilver Elemental has a rather tricky interaction with Leonin Bola. You can actually unattach your opponent's Bola as part of the cost of activating the Elemental-copied ability.
Activated abilities contain a colon. They're generally written "[Cost]: [Effect]." Some keywords are activated abilities and will have colons in their reminder text.

cards.originalText:
{U}: Quicksilver Elemental gains all activated abilities of target creature until end of turn. (If any of the abilities use that creature's name, use this creature's name instead.)
You may spend blue mana as though it were mana of any color to pay the activation costs of Quicksilver Elemental's abilities.

cards.name: Regress
cards.text: Return target permanent to its owner's hand.
cards.flavor:
"Once cast, a spell can be undone. But once revealed, a secret can never again be kept."
—Pontifex, elder researcher
cards.originalText: Return target permanent to its owner's hand.

cards.name: Shared Fate
cards.text:
If a player would draw a card, that player exiles the top card of one of their opponents' libraries face down instead.
Each player may look at and play cards they exiled with Shared Fate.

rulings.text: You need to pay the costs of any cards you play from the Exile zone. This could be a problem if you don't have the right colors of mana available.
Replacing your draws isn't optional. You can't draw cards from your own library, even if all your opponents' libraries are empty.
If more than one Shared Fate is on the battlefield, you choose which one replaces each card draw, but you can replace a draw only once.

The cards are exiled, not put onto the players' hands. Players can look at and play the exiled cards, but can't do anything else with them (the exiled cards can't be discarded or cycled, for example).

Each Shared Fate tracks only the cards it exiled. If the Shared Fate which was responsible for a card being exiled leaves the battlefield, putting another Shared Fate onto the battlefield will not allow you to look at or play that card again.

cards.originalText:
If a player would draw a card, that player removes the top card of an opponent's library from the game face down instead.
Each player may look at and play cards he or she removed from the game with Shared Fate as though they were in his or her hand.

Choose one —
• Each player shuffles their hand and graveyard into their library.
• Each player draws seven cards.

rulings.text: This card won't be put into your graveyard until after it's finished resolving, which means it won't be shuffled into your library as part of its own effect.

cards.originalText:
Choose one Each player shuffles his or her hand and graveyard into his or her library; or each player draws seven cards.
Entwine {2} (Choose both if you pay the entwine cost.)

cards.name: Thirst for Knowledge
cards.text: Draw three cards. Then discard two cards unless you discard an artifact card.
cards.flavor: Lymph, the fluid essence of blinkmoths, is prized by wizards for the rush of intellect it provides.

rulings.text: You can discard either one artifact card or two cards which may or may not be artifacts. If you really want to, you can discard two artifact cards.

cards.originalText: Draw three cards. Then discard two cards from your hand unless you discard an artifact card from your hand.

Draw two cards.

cards.name: Barter in Blood
cards.text: Each player sacrifices two creatures.
cards.flavor:
"In the game of conquest, who cares about the pawns if the king yet reigns?"
—Geth, keeper of the Vault

rulings.text: The active player chooses which creatures will be sacrificed first, then each other player in turn order does the same. Then all creatures are sacrificed simultaneously.
If a player controls only one creature, that creature is sacrificed.
Barter in Blood doesn't target any creatures and may be cast even if a player controls fewer than two creatures.

cards.originalText: Each player sacrifices two creatures.

cards.name: Consume Spirit
cards.text:
Spend only black mana on X.
Consume Spirit deals X damage to any target and you gain X life.
cards.flavor: Mephidross changes all who dwell there, taking their lives and adding them to its own.

rulings.text: The amount of life you gain is equal to the number chosen for X, not the amount of damage Consume Spirit deals (in case some of it is prevented).
If the targeted permanent or player is an illegal target by the time Consume Spirit would resolve, the entire spell doesn't resolve. You won't gain any life.

cards.originalText:
Spend only black mana on X.
Consume Spirit deals X damage to target creature or player. You gain X life.

cards.name: Promise of Power
cards.text:
Choose one —
• You draw five cards and you lose 5 life.
• Create an X/X black Demon creature token with flying, where X is the number of cards in your hand.
Entwine {4} (Choose both if you pay the entwine cost.)

rulings.text: The power/toughness of the token is set when this spell resolves.
The power and toughness of the Demon token are set when Promise of Power resolves. They're unaffected if the number of cards in your hand changes later.
If you pay the entwine cost, you draw five cards, then lose five life, then put the Demon token onto the battlefield. The five cards you draw count toward the Demon's power and toughness.

cards.originalText:
Choose one You draw five cards and you lose 5 life; or put a black Demon creature token with flying into play with power and toughness each equal to the number of cards in your hand as the token comes into play.
Entwine {4} (Choose both if you pay the entwine cost.)
